The Tu-214PU aircraft carrying Putin has entered U.S. airspace, and is expected to land at Anchorage Airport in 1 hr 13 mins.
Putin's Tu-214PU is approaching Anchorage Elmendorf Airbase for landing, and is being tracked by over 340,000 people on Flightradar.

2 Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers departed from Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast. They are still in Saratov Oblast, and the purpose of the flight is unknown. Following the recent movements to and from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, it is believed that 2/3rds‚Ä¶
Correction: These two Tu-95s have been airborne for around an hour. A Tu-160 has departed a short time ago, however.
Putin's Tu-214PU is approaching Anchorage Elmendorf Airbase for landing, and is being tracked by over 340,000 people on Flightradar.
This reminds me of something...
Putin's Tu-214PU has just touched down at Anchorage Elmendorf Airbase, Alaska.
U.S. President Donald Trump has arrived at Joint Base Elmendorf‚ÄìRichardson in Anchorage, Alaska. The meeting with Putin is set to begin in just over an hour.

Reminder: Trump wants the war in Ukraine to continue. He just needs a way out of supplying Ukraine with weapons and aid, which is where Europe comes into play. 
Keeping the war going is in Trump's best interests in regard to tackling the main threat to U.S. hegemony: China. Why stop a war which has Russia distracted and committed, when you can let it play out even further and use that time to your advantage? 
Unfortunately, this will mean much more death and destruction in a war which has its outcome sealed if peace is not made. But when in pursuit of power - or in America's case, maintaining the power of an aging empire - administrations will go at great lengths with little worry about the costs, as long as it doesn't have significant effects back at home.
Don't expect much of today's talks, or you will be very disappointed.

Reminder: Trump wants the war in Ukraine to continue. He just needs a way out of supplying Ukraine with weapons and aid, which is where Europe comes into play.   Keeping the war going is in Trump's best interests in regard to tackling the main threat to U.S.‚Ä¶
Ngl, if you told 2023 me that I'd be writing a post like this in 2025, I would've called you crazy. But here we are...

With the Trump-Putin meeting set to begin in around 20 minutes, the first Russian Geran-2 drone launches have been recorded.
These are from:
Primorsko-Akhtarsk Airbase, Krasnodar Krai.
Shatalovo Airbase, Smolensk Oblast.
Tsumbolova Test Site, Oryol Oblast.
The first groups of Gerans (at least 10 units) from Primorsko-Akhtarsk flew north past Hulyaipole, Zaporizhzhia Oblast towards Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Tactical aviation continues its work as usual. Over the past 6 hours, targets were struck with KAB/FAB glide-bombs in and around:
Bilopillya, Sumy Oblast.
Vorozhba, Sumy Oblast.
Richky, Sumy Oblast.
Yunakivka, Sumy Oblast.
Velykyi Burluk, Kharkiv Oblast.
Lyman, Donetsk Oblast.
Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.
Pokrovsk, Donetsk Oblast.
Novopavlivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Additionally, over the past few hours, 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles impacted a target in southern Dnipro, 2 Iskander-Ms impacted a target in Honcharivske, Chernihiv Oblast (likely the training ground), and 1 Iskander-M impacted a target in Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Trump and Putin have now met in Anchorage, Alaska.

With the Trump-Putin meeting set to begin in around 20 minutes, the first Russian Geran-2 drone launches have been recorded.  These are from: Primorsko-Akhtarsk Airbase, Krasnodar Krai. Shatalovo Airbase, Smolensk Oblast. Tsumbolova Test Site, Oryol Oblast.‚Ä¶
The 10+ drones from Zaporizhzhia Oblast are probably going to attack the Dobropillya area of Donetsk Oblast.

Ukrainian forces have re-established control over the village of Hruzke, Bilozerske direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~176.
Total land area: ~0.89km¬≤.
The three-on-three meeting involving Trump and Putin has begun in Anchorage, Alaska.

The Trump-Putin meeting proceeded without any big surprises. It lasted for around three hours, and both sides emphasised that it was positive and productive (I doubt this will be the same narrative in a couple of weeks).
Trump claimed that they were "pretty close to a deal", and once again urged Zelensky to negotiate. Putin expressed his wish for the war to end, and stated that he believed the war wouldn't have started in 2022 if Trump were president back then.
The 10+ drones from Zaporizhzhia Oblast are probably going to attack the Dobropillya area of Donetsk Oblast.

Last night, another large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 20 impacts were recorded in Dobropillya. Novodonetske, Bilozerske, Oleksandrivka, Ocheretyne, Svyatohorivka, and Slovyansk (media 1 & 2). Additionally, KAB glide-bombs struck targets in Dobropillya, Bilozerske, Novodonetske, and Oleksandrivka (media 3 & 4). 
This is the first time Oleksandrivka has been struck by glide-bombs, and it was previously one of the last areas of Donetsk Oblast out of their range.

Last night, another large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast.
At least 20 impacts were recorded in Dobropillya. Novodonetske, Bilozerske, Oleksandrivka, Ocheretyne, Svyatohorivka, and Slovyansk (media 1 & 2). Additionally, KAB glide-bombs struck targets in Dobropillya, Bilozerske, Novodonetske, and Oleksandrivka (media 3 & 4). 
This is the first time Oleksandrivka has been struck by glide-bombs, and it was previously one of the last areas of Donetsk Oblast out of their range.
Last night, multiple Russian Geran-2 drones impacted the "Golden Coast" hotel southwest of Vovchansk, Kharkiv Oblast. NASA FIRMS data picked up a large fire burning there.

Last night, Russian Geran-2 drones attacked the town of Pokrovske, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. Impacts were recorded at a pig farm complex, and the grain elevator. NASA FIRMS data shows that fires are burning at both sites. 
The Dnipropetrovsk OVA Acknowledged the strikes but did not provide any additional details to what we already know.

Russian forces have captured the village of Oleksandrohrad, Pokrovske Direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~122.
Total land area: ~0.53km¬≤.

Pentagon Effectively Confirms 'Golden Dome' Will Breach Outer Space Treaty 
L
ast week, the Pentagon presented more details about the upcoming "Golden Dome", revealing that it will be a four-layer missile defense system and that it will also include a space-based component (the other three are ground-based, including eleven short-range batteries planned for deployment in the continental US, Alaska and Hawaii). Reuters cited a presentation of the project, titled "Go Fast, Think Big!", shown in Huntsville, Alabama, last week to around 3,000 representatives of the American Military Industrial Complex (MIC).
The revelation didn't really show much more than what was¬†already known about the US strategic missile defenses. The slides revealed there would be early warning satellites for detecting missile launches, tracking and "boost-phase interception". 
______________

Hezbollah Leader Vows ‚ÄòNo Life In Lebanon,‚Äô Warns U.S. Embassy Over Disarmament Plot 
Hezbollah Secretary-General Naim Qassem on August 15 condemned the Lebanese government‚Äôs recent decision to approve a plan to disarm his group by the end of the year, warning that any attempt to implement the plan will undermine the country‚Äôs national security.
In an extended speech, Qassem emphasized that Hezbollah ‚Äúwill not hand over its weapons as long as the occupation exists and aggression continues.‚Äù
The leader said that the group would fight a ‚ÄúKarbala-like battle‚Äù ‚Äì a reference to the 7th-century clash central to Shi‚Äôite Muslim identity ‚Äì against what he described as the American-Israeli project, expressing confidence in victory, and placing ‚Äúfull responsibility on the Lebanese government for any strife that may occur.‚Äù
Read more 
HERE

Russia Is Testing Remotely-Controlled ATGM Launcher In Special Operation Zone
The Kirov Plant Mayak, a part of the Kalashnikov Group, trained Russian troops on the use of an advanced remote control system for the Fagot anti-tank guided missile (ATGM), the Russian defense giant announced on August 14.
In a news release, the group said that representatives from the Kirov Plant Mayak provided comprehensive instruction to operators of the Fagot ATGM belonging to one of the troop units deployed in the special military operation zone in Ukraine.
The training covered the operational principles of the upgraded remote control system, including its mounting procedures and key operational features, according to the release.
Kalashnikov officials said that the remote control kit was issued to the troops for autonomous training and real-world testing across diverse environments, including open fields, wooded areas, and urban settings.
Read more 
HERE

Russia Launches Improved Project 22350 Frigate 
The Severnaya Verf Shipyard in Russia St. Petersburg launched on August 14 the improved Project 22350 frigate ‚ÄúAdmiral Amelko‚Äù.
Project 22350 frigates have a displacement of about 5,000 tons, and can accelerate to 29 knots. The frigates are capable of engaging enemy aircraft carrier groups and other surface targets, providing air defense for naval formations, supporting amphibious operations, striking land and sea targets, and conducting anti-submarine warfare.
Russian Navy Commander-in-Chief Admiral Alexander Moiseyev said that Admiral Amelko is capable of performing all tasks typical of a multi-purpose warship, in both near and far sea zones.
Read more

Russian Forces Make Strategic Gains Across Multiple Fronts in Pivotal Week of Fighting
The past week of Russia‚Äôs special military operation has delivered significant battlefield successes, with Ukrainian forces largely retreating and losing territory across most sectors. The only area where Ukrainian troops continue counterattacking is near Stepnogorsk in the Zaporizhzhia region, while even their previously active Sumy axis has lost momentum.
Russian ‚ÄúNorthern‚Äù grouping forces continue advancing in both Sumy and Kharkiv regions, though progress remains tactical against stiff Ukrainian resistance. The redeployment of some Ukrainian units to more critical sectors has weakened defenses here, reducing counterattack capabilities. In the Kupiansk direction, fierce urban combat continues as Russian troops push to fully secure the strategically important city. 
Read more 
HERE

Israeli Army Chief Hints At New Attack On Iran
Israeli military chief of staff Lt. Gen. Eyal Zamir on August 14 hinted at the possibility of launching another attack on Iran.
During a speech at a military ceremony at the Glilot base in central Israel, Zamir said that the Israeli military was ready to repeat its strike on Iran if necessary.
Israel launched a surprise attack against Iran on June 13, stating that its goal was to cripple the Islamic Republic‚Äôs nuclear program. The war ended when a ceasefire was suddenly announced on June 24, just two days after the United States joined the war by attacking three Iranian nuclear sites.
Read more 
HERE

Ukraine Planned To Produce 200 Ballistic Missiles Every Month: Russian Intelligence
The Ukrainian military-industrial complex planned to produce 200 Sapsan ballistic missiles per month before the program was derailed as a result of a special operation carried out by the Russian Defense Ministry and the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB).
The FSB obtained intelligence on Ukraine‚Äôs secret missile program, which was then targeted by the MoD. Chemical and mechanical plants in Pavlograd, Dneptropetrovsk Region, as well as the ‚ÄúZvezda‚Äù plant and State Scientific Research Institute of Chemical Products in Shostka, Sumy Region were struck during the operation.
The Sapsan, also known as Hirm and Grom, is believed to have a maximum range of 700 kilometers and a warhead weighing 480 kg. The FSB warned that the missile would have been capable of hitting a large part of Western Russia, including the capital Moscow.
